text: A celestial track...
author: Michael Touitou

text: Shame the recent star ocean game was an absolute atrocity. Loved this series to death!
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: AWESOME AWESOME Song and Soundtrack. Too many damn memories in this world... The nostalgia is bringing some inner feelz!!!
author: 60secondrhymes

text: This is definitely one of my favorite vgm tracks of all time. It really succeeds in communicating the clean, pure, and refreshing quality of life in a non-industrial country town.
author: David Alvarez

text:
The whole atmosphere in Arlia is quite amazing as well.
I can actually feel the smell of herbs when I hear this music and Claude goes "something smells good" in the item shop.
author: Laurelindo

text: Absolutely! Arlia is a real achievement in creating a believable, immersive, and tranquil setting. I always enjoyed coming back to Arlia later after having explored more of Expel.
author: David Alvarez

text: Dias: Piece of junk. He was my favorite character
author: DigitalxReaper

text: never got the chance to finish it :(

text: Siigggh this brings me back.
author: Sam Brown

text: Probably Sakuraba's best soundtrack, written when he was still inspired.
author: jb1980ist

text: is it just me... or do I hear in the bg of this song the main theme of final fantasy o_o ?
author: Evilriku13

text: You mean the Prelude? Yeah, the background piano progression is somewhat similar to the melody of that theme, but Sakuraba has used this same progression since he began composing in 1989.
author: Bryan Delmond

text: Motoi Sakuraba ftw!!
author: princedraco5

text: Love the Star Ocean series SO much. Wish we could play Blue Sphere, and that a sequel would be announced!

text: Never forget Precise's HERE BUNNY!

text: Except on the PS1 it sounded like HERE BARNEY!

text: Quite nice to wake up to!!

text: This should be number 1 on the list, and 2 and 3 and so on and so on...

text: the series went way downhill after this game for me. SO2 is in my top 5
author: joey tunafish

text: I dont understand why you had to bring negativity to it. Just enjoy the damn music.
author: alternine

text: @alternine He didn't call people who enjoyed the later SO games idiots or anything just gave an opinion. One I happen to share. SO2 was by far the best of the series in my opinion as well.
author: Marshall Price

text:
+Marshall Price
"Star Ocean" for the Super Famicom is great as well.
It's not quite as polished as SO2, but it definitely has the same charm and introduced things like Talents, Skills, Specialties and Private Actions.

text:
I never played the sequels, but SPOILER 
reading how in SO3 a major plottwist reveals that everything is a simulation broke my heart a little.
author: ShakeITyEA

text: SO2: absolutely legendary Sakuraba. I will never forget this game and its masterful music.
author: CleverDjembe

text: Kinda reminds me of Jet Force Gemini, has the same feel to it
author: Maxo14

text: This always was a magical game to experience. I loved the soundtrack too.
author: notyoursavior78

text: I remember the first time I played this game and I felt completely immersed by the surroundings in Arlia - I could actually sort of feel the scent of the herbs in the shop, and I could vividly imagine what the air must have felt like.
author: Laurelindo

text: Yeah the same. I remember really knowing the feeling of being at peace Rena had in the Arlia woods because I would go camping or just walk through the woods myself.
author: notyoursavior78

text: Cure me a river
author: Sephiko

text: This was probably my favorite PS1 RPG, good good times.
author: Scott Chambers

text: Yep, this is still my favorite Sakuraba soundtrack. His mix of strings, flute and harp is absolutely magical in this game. I've been wanting to play the first game on the PSP for a while now, so that's another game I'll have to add to my ridiculous backlog.
author: SupraDarky

text: It's definitely worth the playthrough, but the overworld travelling is sooooo much slower for First Departure.
author: Aaron Smith

text: Fuck video game backlogs... feels like I'll never have time to play them... and they keep adding up!
author: Mr. Fuzzums

text: @Mr. Fuzzums Agreed... I use Backloggery to keep track, but I still seem to be getting more games than I beat!
author: NeatNit

text: That's what I was waiting for, you doing comments about every track you upload, That's cool ;)
author: MarioSoundtrack

text: @SupraDarky Favourite Star Ocean Game as well, not certain that the Fifth in the series that's been revealed will be up to snuff considering what we've seen so far. Still eager though.
author: Vordox

text:
+SupraDarky This is the game that made me fall in love with Sakuraba, instantly. Some 15 years on, I still think it's among his best - though I feel Valkyrie Profile has now taken first place, unfortunately. 

Though I find most of the rest of his work a tad disappointing after I know he's capable of creating masterworks like this. He had some good tracks in Tales of Xillia, I thought, and Baten Kaitos. But a lot of his stuff sounds too derivative. I know he's a keyboardist, but give him licence to go ham on those synths and he really will overuse them... not my style I'm afraid.
author: Harkz0r

text: well said Supra. the subtle Harp plings just add pure magic to some of the tracks.
author: ShakeITyEA
